verses.text: 至高 神的祭司麥基洗德這麥基洗德就是撒冷王，又是至高 神的祭司。亞伯拉罕殺敗眾王回來的時候，麥基洗德迎接他，並且給他祝福。

words.note: Often used in '至高的神' (Most High God)
Refers to the monotheistic God; often capitalized in Bible translations.
Often used in '至高的神' (Most High God)
Refers to the monotheistic God; often capitalized in Bible translations.
Literally 'kill and defeat'.
Connects a modifying clause to '時候'.

verses.text: 亞伯拉罕也把自己得來的一切，拿出十分之一來給他。麥基洗德這名字翻譯出來，頭一個意思就是「公義的王」；其次是「撒冷王」，就是「平安的王」的意思。

words.note: Indicates the object precedes the verb.
Here indicates the result of translation.

verses.text: 他沒有父親，沒有母親，沒有族譜，也沒有生死的記錄，而是與 神的兒子相似，永遠作祭司。

words.note: Refers to a written record of ancestry.
More formal than '跟' or '和'.
Refers to the monotheistic God; often capitalized in Bible translations.

verses.text: 麥基洗德的祭司職分你們想一想這人是多麼偉大啊！祖先亞伯拉罕也要從上等的擄物中，拿出十分之一來給了他。

words.note: Reduplicated verb indicates a brief or repeated action, often for emphasis.
Here implies 'even had to'.

verses.text: 那些領受祭司職分的利未子孫，奉命按照律法向人民，就是自己的弟兄，收取十分之一；雖然他們都是出於亞伯拉罕的。

words.note: Often used for receiving something formal or spiritual.
Connects the modifying clause to '利未子孫'.
A more formal way to say 'follow orders'.
Can refer to male siblings or fellow believers.
Indicates origin or source.
Here implies 'of Abraham's lineage/descent'.

verses.text: 可是那不與他們同譜系的麥基洗德，反而收納了亞伯拉罕的十分之一，並且給這蒙受應許的人祝福。

words.note: Refers to a shared ancestral line.
A verb-object compound.
Often refers to a tithe in religious contexts.
Often used for receiving divine favor or suffering.
Frequently refers to God's promise.
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 向來都是位分大的給位分小的祝福，這是毫無疑問的。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
An idiomatic expression.

verses.text: 在這裡，收取十分之一的，都是必死的；但在那裡，收納十分之一的，卻被證實是一位活著的。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Often refers to a tithe in religious contexts.
Emphasizes mortality.
A verb-object compound.
Often refers to a tithe in religious contexts.

verses.text: 並且可以這樣說，連那收取十分之一的利未，也透過亞伯拉罕繳納了十分之一。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Often refers to a tithe in religious contexts.
A verb-object compound.
Often refers to a tithe in religious contexts.

verses.text: 因為麥基洗德迎接亞伯拉罕的時候，利未還在他祖先的身體裡面。

words.note: A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 耶穌按麥基洗德體系作祭司這樣看來，如果藉著利未人的祭司制度能達到完全的地步，為甚麼還需要照著麥基洗德的體系，另外興起一位祭司，而不照著亞倫的體系呢？

words.note: Often used for receiving intangible things like grace or knowledge.

verses.text: 祭司的制度既然更改了，律法也必須更改。
因為這些話所指的那位，原是屬於另外一個支派的，這支派向來沒有人在祭壇前供職。

words.note: More formal or literary; implies holding a position.

verses.text: 我們的主明明是從猶大支派出來的，關於這個支派，摩西並沒有提及祭司的事。

words.note: Here refers to Jesus/God.
Used before negatives (不/沒有) to add emphasis.

verses.text: 如果有另一位像麥基洗德那樣的祭司興起來，那麼，這裡所說的就更明顯了。
他成了祭司，不是按著律法上肉身的條例，卻是按著不能毀壞的生命的大能。

words.note: One who officiates sacrifices
Refers to the Mosaic Law
Indicates 'in terms of' or 'within the scope of'
Often refers to God's omnipotence

verses.text: 因為有為他作證的說：「你永遠作祭司，是照著麥基洗德的體系。」

words.note: Turns preceding phrase into a noun-like entity ('one who testifies')
Transliteration of a Hebrew name

verses.text: 一方面，從前的條例因為軟弱，沒有用處，就廢棄了；

words.note: Often used in biblical context for spiritual weakness

verses.text: （因為律法從來沒有使甚麼得到完全，）另一方面，它卻帶來了更美的盼望，藉著這盼望，我們就可以親近 神。

words.note: Used with negation (e.g., '沒有') to mean 'never'
Often used for approaching God
Reverent form for the monotheistic God. The leading space is a reverence marker.

verses.text: 此外，還有關於誓言的事。其他成為祭司的，並不是用誓言立的；

words.note: Turns preceding phrase into a noun-like entity ('those who became priests')
A strong negation: 'definitely not', 'by no means'
Emphasizes the manner or agent of an action.

verses.text: 只有耶穌是用誓言立的，因為那立他的對他說：「主已經起了誓，決不改變，你永遠作祭司。」

words.note: Lit. 'oath-word'.
Used here as a demonstrative pronoun referring to 'the one who'.
Refers to God or Christ in Christian contexts.
Here, part of '起誓' (qǐshì) meaning 'to swear an oath'.
Often used with '起' to form '起誓' (qǐshì).
One who manages sacrifices or worship.

verses.text: 耶穌既然是用誓言立的，就成了更美好的約的保證。

words.note: Here '更美好' means 'better' or 'more excellent'.

verses.text: 一方面，從前那些作祭司的，因為受死亡的限制，不能長久留任，所以人數眾多。
另一方面，因為耶穌是永遠長存的，就擁有他永不更改的祭司職位。

words.note: Describes something that endures or lasts eternally.
Stronger than '從不'.

verses.text: 因此，那些靠著他進到 神面前的人，他都能拯救到底；因為他長遠活著，為他們代求。

words.note: The raised dot indicates reverence for God.
Similar to '永遠', often implying a continuous state.
To pray or make requests on behalf of others.

verses.text: 這樣的一位大祭司，對我們本是合適的。他是聖潔、沒有邪惡、沒有玷污、從罪人中分別出來、高過眾天的。

words.note: 位 is a respectful measure word for people.
Lit. 'great sacrificing manager'.
Often functions as a verb complement.

verses.text: 他不必像那些大祭司，天天先為自己的罪獻祭，然後為人民的罪獻祭；因為他獻上了自己，就把這事一次而永遠的成全了。

words.note: A common verb-object compound in religious texts.
Means to fully achieve or bring to perfection.

verses.text: 律法所立的大祭司，都是軟弱的人；可是在律法以後，用誓言所立的兒子，卻是成為完全直到永遠的。

words.note: Indicates the preceding noun is the agent or means of the verb.
